citations.narrative:
The primary enclosure did not contain two rabbits. A self-report stated that on August 22, 2022, separately housed male
and female rabbits were seen together in the same cage by animal care technicians. The divider between the enclosures
was not latched properly and the animals were able to access each other's primary enclosure. As a result, the male was
then able to impregnate the female. Animals that are not securely contained in their primary enclosures could become
entrapped or injured. Primary enclosures shall be structurally sound and maintained in good repair to protect the rabbits
from injury, to contain them, and to keep predators out. Correct by ensuring enclosures properly contain the animal.
Corrective actions were taken prior to the inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the attending veterinarian.
Additional Inspectors:
COURTNEY JERNIGAN, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.53(a)(1) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
The primary enclosure did not contain two rabbits.  A self-report stated that on August 22, 2022, separately housed male 
and female rabbits were seen together in the same cage by animal care technicians. The divider between the enclosures 
was not latched properly and the animals were able to access each other's primary enclosure. As a result, the male was 
then able to impregnate the female. Animals that are not securely contained in their primary enclosures could become 
entrapped or injured. Primary enclosures shall be structurally sound and maintained in good repair to protect the rabbits 
from injury, to contain them, and to keep predators out. Correct by ensuring enclosures properly contain the animal. 
Corrective actions were taken prior to the inspection. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the attending veterinarian. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
COURTNEY JERNIGAN, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
